Created an attachment (id=77270)
Quick fix

Got it (The only difference is that I've the error logged for 'org.eclipse.ui' plug-in). I hope checking for a null container will fix the problem. It works for me at least.

It is possible that the root of the problem here is that, unlike most editor inputs, the CompareEditorInput is tightly coupled with the editor that contains it. When you do a New Editor, it assumes that the CompareEditorInput can be resused for a second editor. However, we CompareEditorInputs this is not the case. The patch you provided may fix the NPE but be sure to perform a full sets of tests on the remainign editor to ensure that it hasn't been corrupted. If my suspicion is correct, you will see some failures.

You were right Michael, the quickest way to get an exception thrown is to open a new editor, make a change, save it and close the editor. The first compare editor will throw an error from Java Structure Compare tree saying:

Tomek, the patch looks good. You can add one thing though. Wen you open the history view first time on the new workspace, the search field is not visible, but the action is checked. Fix that and I will look at the patch again.
Sorry for the comment #4. It should have been added to another bug.
I have released the path to HEAD. The general issue of New Editor is covered by bug 146021
